What is a negative correlation in 'Introduction to Logic and Critical Thinking' by Matthew Van Cleave?
A negative correlation occurs when an increase in one variable leads to a decrease in another.

Case 2 ~A ~B C D ~G Case 3 A ~B C ~D ~G Case 1 A B ~C D ~G Case 2 ~A ~B ~C D ~G Case 3 A ~B ~C ~D ~G Case 1 A B C D G Case 2 ~A ~B C D G Case 3 A ~B ~C D ~G Case 1 ~A B ~C D ~G Case 2 ~A B C D G Case 3 ~A ~B ~C D G Chapter 3: Evaluating inductive arguments and probabilistic and statistical fallacies  170 6. At one point in history, there was a negative correlation between the number of mules in the state (Aand the salaries paid to professors at the state university (B). That is, the more mules, the lower the professors’ salaries. 7. There is a strong positive correlation between the number of traffic accidents on a particular highway (A) and the number of billboards featuring scantily-clad models (B). 8.
